com.salesforce.androidsdk.ui

Class OAuthWebviewHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.androidsdk.ui.OAuthWebviewHelper

  • public class OAuthWebviewHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to manage a WebView instance that is going through the OAuth login process. Basic flow is a) load and show the login page to the user b) user logins in and authorizes app c) we see the navigation to the auth complete Url, and grab the tokens d) we call the Id service to obtain additional info about the user e) we create a local account, and return an authentication result bundle. f) done!

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  OAuthWebviewHelper.AccountOptions
      Class encapsulating the parameters required to create a new account
      protected class  OAuthWebviewHelper.AuthWebChromeClient
      WebChromeClient used to report back loading progress.
      protected class  OAuthWebviewHelper.AuthWebViewClient
      WebViewClient which intercepts the redirect to the oauth callback url.
      protected class  OAuthWebviewHelper.BaseFinishAuthFlowTask<RequestType> 
      static interface  OAuthWebviewHelper.OAuthWebviewHelperEvents
      the host activity/fragment should pass in an implementation of this interface so that it can notify it of things it needs to do as part of the oauth process.

      • onNewPasscode

        public void onNewPasscode()
        Method called by login activity when it resumes after the passcode activity When the server has a mobile policy requiring a passcode, we start the passcode activity after completing the auth flow (see onAuthFlowComplete). When the passcode activity completes, the login activity's onActivityResult gets invoked, and it calls this method to finalize the account creation.

      • getAuthorizationDisplayType

        protected java.lang.String getAuthorizationDisplayType()
        Override this to replace the default login webview's display param with your custom display param. You can override this by either subclassing this class, or adding "desiredDisplayParam" to your app's resource so that it overrides the default value in the SDK library.
        Returns:
        the OAuth login display type, e.g. 'mobile', 'touch', see the OAuth docs for the complete list of valid values.

      • getLoginUrl

        protected java.lang.String getLoginUrl()
        Override this method to customize the login url.
        Returns:
        login url

      • onAuthFlowComplete

        protected void onAuthFlowComplete(OAuth2.TokenEndpointResponse tr)
        Called when the user facing part of the auth flow completed successfully. The last step is to call the identity service to get the username.
